title: The Dictionary Sage
subtitle: Advanced Dictionary Operations
description:
# Mastering Dictionaries

You've worked with dictionaries, but there's so much more! Learn advanced techniques to manipulate these powerful data structures.

## Dictionary Methods

```python
player = {"name": "Aria", "level": 5, "gold": 100}

# Get values safely
name = player.get("name")           # "Aria"
class_type = player.get("class", "Warrior")  # Default if missing

# Get all keys, values, items
keys = player.keys()         # dict_keys(['name', 'level', 'gold'])
values = player.values()     # dict_values(['Aria', 5, 100])
items = player.items()       # dict_items([('name', 'Aria'), ...])

# Update dictionary
player.update({"class": "Mage", "level": 6})

# Remove items
level = player.pop("level")   # Remove and return value
last = player.popitem()       # Remove and return last item

# Check existence
if "gold" in player:
    print("Has gold")
```

## Looping Through Dictionaries

```python
# Loop through keys
for key in player:
    print(key)

# Loop through values
for value in player.values():
    print(value)

# Loop through key-value pairs
for key, value in player.items():
    print(f"{key}: {value}")
```

## Your Quest

Create a character stat manager:
1. Use .get() with defaults
2. Update stats with .update()
3. Loop through stats to display them
4. Calculate total stat points
starterCode:
# Character Stat Manager

character = {
    "name": "Thorin",
    "level": 10,
    "health": 100,
    "mana": 50,
    "strength": 15,
    "intelligence": 10
}

print(f"Level: {character['level']}")

# Get stats with defaults
defense = character.get(___, ___)  # Get 'defense', default to 5 if missing
print(f"Defense: {defense}")

print("\n=== LEVELING UP ===")
# Update multiple stats at once
character.update(___)  # Increase level by 1, add 20 health, add 10 mana
print("Leveled up!")

print("\n=== CURRENT STATS ===")
# Loop through all stats and display
for stat, value in ___:  # Loop through items()
    print(f"{stat}: {value}")

print("\n=== STAT CALCULATION ===")
# Calculate total stat points (strength + intelligence + defense)
# Hint: Use .get() for defense since it might not exist
str_val = character.get(___, ___)
int_val = character.get(___, ___)
def_val = character.get(___, ___)
total_stats = ___  # Sum them up
print(f"Total stat points: {total_stats}")

print("\n=== REMOVING MANA ===")
removed_mana = character.pop(___)  # Remove 'mana' key
print(f"Removed {removed_mana} mana")
print(f"Remaining stats: {list(character.keys())}")
solutionCode:
# Character Stat Manager

character = {
    "name": "Thorin",
    "level": 10,
    "health": 100,
    "mana": 50,
    "strength": 15,
    "intelligence": 10
}

print("=== CHARACTER INFO ===")
print(f"Name: {character['name']}")
print(f"Level: {character['level']}")

# Get stats with defaults
defense = character.get("defense", 5)
print(f"Defense: {defense}")

print("\n=== LEVELING UP ===")
# Update multiple stats at once
character.update({"level": 11, "health": 120, "mana": 60})
print("Leveled up!")

print("\n=== CURRENT STATS ===")
# Loop through all stats and display
for stat, value in character.items():
    print(f"{stat}: {value}")

print("\n=== STAT CALCULATION ===")
# Calculate total stat points
str_val = character.get("strength", 0)
int_val = character.get("intelligence", 0)
def_val = character.get("defense", 0)
total_stats = str_val + int_val + def_val
print(f"Total stat points: {total_stats}")

print("\n=== REMOVING MANA ===")
removed_mana = character.pop("mana")
print(f"Removed {removed_mana} mana")
print(f"Remaining stats: {list(character.keys())}")
hints: Use character.get('defense', 5) to get defense with default value 5
Use character.update({'level': 11, 'health': 120, 'mana': 60}) to update multiple values
Loop with: for stat, value in character.items():
Use character.pop('mana') to remove and return mana value

Complete solution:

defense = character.get('defense', 5)
character.update({'level': 11, 'health': 120, 'mana': 60})
for stat, value in character.items():
    print(f'{stat}: {value}')
total_stats = character.get('strength', 0) + character.get('intelligence', 0) + character.get('defense', 0)
learningObjectives: Use .get() for safe value access with defaults
